subject: Marketing
title: Radio Changes Everything
description: A fast breakdown of Radio Changes Everything for builders.

hook.text: In 1922, a New York radio station sold its first ad spot for $50. Mass audio advertising began.

buildup.text: Radio entered living rooms. For the first time, ads could speak directly to families at home.

discovery.text: Sound created intimacy that print never could. A voice felt like a personal recommendation.

twist.text: Brands didn't just buy ad spotsâ€”they sponsored entire shows. 'Soap operas' got their name this way.

climax.text: Radio proved that owning the content was as powerful as owning the ad slot.

punchline.text: The voice in your home became the voice you trusted.

quiz.question: How did the term 'soap opera' originate?
options: Soap companies sponsored the radio drama shows
The first TV drama was set in a soap factory
Soap was the most advertised product on television
